description: Control settings incorrectly implemented or inconsistent with baseline; recurring deviation after updates.
indicative_signals: Configuration drift detected; repeated deviations from baseline; rollback events increasing.
rationale: Configuration drift reflects unmanaged change, indicating control execution is inconsistent or bypassed.
notes: Configuration baselines, segmentation policies, and continuous monitoring reduce setup drift and inconsistent enforcement.

description: Delay in applying security updates or firmware; exposure window widened.
indicative_signals: Patch backlog > threshold; recurring “out-of-date” alerts; known CVEs unpatched.
rationale: Patch backlog exposes systems to known vulnerabilities and signals weak update discipline.
notes: Integrated vulnerability and patch workflows minimise exposure from delayed updates.

description: Compromise of credentials through phishing, malware, or reuse across systems.
indicative_signals: Multiple failed logins followed by success; anomalous geolocation; MFA bypass events.
rationale: Abnormal login patterns or MFA bypass attempts suggest compromised credentials in use.
notes: Strong credential hygiene, adaptive authentication, and mobile safeguards reduce theft probability.

description: Over-used or easily phished multi-factor tokens; push-fatigue exploitation.
indicative_signals: Excessive push notifications; repeated MFA prompts ignored; token reuse in logs.
rationale: Repetitive MFA prompts and reused tokens imply user fatigue or token interception risk.
notes: Multi-factor rotation and contextual authorisation detect fatigue or replay attempts.

description: Legitimate access abused for unauthorised activity or data exfiltration.
indicative_signals: Data access outside normal hours; privileged downloads; abnormal copy activity.
rationale: Irregular data-access events imply misuse of legitimate privileges or insider activity.
notes: Behavioural analytics and physical access logging constrain privileged misuse.

description: Unauthorised increase in access level due to flawed permissions or exploits.
indicative_signals: Sudden role changes; privilege escalation alerts; ACL modifications without ticket.
rationale: Sudden privilege changes without justification indicate potential escalation or control gaps.
notes: Privilege lifecycle governance limits unauthorised elevation paths.

description: Critical events not captured, parsed, or correlated; gaps in audit trail.
indicative_signals: Missing or truncated logs; gaps in time sequence; uncorrelated alert spikes.
rationale: Missing or incomplete logs prevent detection and post-incident analysis.
notes: Unified telemetry and anomaly detection ensure high-fidelity event capture.

description: Backups damaged, encrypted, or unverified; restoration integrity uncertain.
indicative_signals: Backup verification errors; checksum mismatches; failed restore tests.
rationale: Failed restore or checksum errors show backups may be unusable during recovery.
notes: Environmental isolation and redundancy validation protect restoration integrity.

description: Third-party outage or compromise impacts dependent internal controls.
indicative_signals: Third-party outage notices; SLA breach alerts; dependency-chain failures.
rationale: Vendor service disruptions or SLA breaches highlight over-reliance on third parties.
notes: Multi-vendor oversight and tested recovery plans reduce single-point-of-failure risk.

description: Vulnerability introduced through evolving inter-system communication.
indicative_signals: API errors after update; schema mismatch; integration heartbeat failures.
rationale: Integration failures or API drift reveal insecure inter-system dependencies.
notes: Secure API gateways and integration governance detect unauthorised calls or schema drift.

description: Unauthorised tools or services bypass governance and monitoring.
indicative_signals: Unregistered SaaS traffic; unmanaged endpoints; unknown DNS calls.
rationale: Unmanaged tools indicate poor asset governance and hidden exposure points.
notes: Awareness programs and asset inventories expose unsanctioned applications.

description: Incorrect or missing sensitivity tagging leads to mis-handled data.
indicative_signals: Files missing sensitivity labels; inconsistent metadata; DLP mis-tags.
rationale: Inconsistent data labelling undermines confidentiality and DLP effectiveness.
notes: Enforced classification policy and device tagging mitigate unlabelled data flow.

description: Data exposure via external partner platform or integration point.
indicative_signals: External file-sharing detected; data found on partner domains; leakage alerts.
rationale: External file sharing or partner leaks point to insufficient third-party safeguards.
notes: Vendor assessments and integrated response protocols contain cross-boundary leaks.

description: Encryption or signing keys exposed, reused, or weakly protected.
indicative_signals: Key reuse events; expired certificates; unauthorized key export logs.
rationale: Key reuse or expired certificates compromise encryption trust chains.
notes: Encryption-key rotation and protected transport maintain cryptographic trust.

description: ACLs overly permissive; conflicting roles or group inheritance.
indicative_signals: Overlapping group permissions; broad “any” access rules; orphaned accounts.
rationale: Broad or conflicting access rules create privilege creep and lateral exposure.
notes: Periodic review of logical and physical ACLs ensures least-privilege alignment.

description: Lateral movement enabled through trust-zone misconfiguration.
indicative_signals: East-west traffic anomaly; lateral movement indicators; VLAN crossover.
rationale: Unexpected internal traffic shows segmentation or isolation controls have been bypassed.
notes: Layered segmentation and patch discipline prevent lateral compromise.

description: Security event occurs without timely alert or escalation.
indicative_signals: Alert latency > SLA; missing correlation between detection and incident start.
rationale: Late or missing alerts reduce containment speed and increase impact duration.
notes: Correlated telemetry and playbook integration accelerate alert response.

description: Policy implementation diverges from design intent over time.
indicative_signals: Control audit deltas increasing; undocumented process steps; config variance.
rationale: Divergence between policy and implementation signals process erosion over time.
notes: Continuous assurance and configuration baselining preserve intended control posture.

description: Roles, responsibilities, or escalation unclear during crisis.
indicative_signals: Delayed incident bridge activation; duplicated ownership emails; missed hand-offs.
rationale: Unclear incident roles delay containment and reflect weak operational coordination.
notes: Defined roles and rehearsed communication enable cohesive incident response.

description: Restoration fails to return systems to a trusted, validated state.
indicative_signals: Partial restore success; missing validation reports; residual corruption errors.
rationale: Incomplete restoration jeopardises data integrity and continuity assurances.
notes: Tested recovery workflows and redundant facilities restore systems to a trusted state.

description: Absence of ownership, periodic review, or board visibility.
indicative_signals: No control owner listed; overdue review tasks; governance board gap.
rationale: Absence of control ownership leads to unmanaged risk and audit failures.
notes: Clear ownership and periodic review cycles sustain control accountability.

description: Control intent erodes through undocumented procedural change.
indicative_signals: Procedure updates unrecorded; staff using obsolete SOPs; version skew.
rationale: Untracked procedural updates create ambiguity over current control practice.
notes: Structured policy frameworks and risk-methodology alignment prevent silent divergence.

description: Control excluded or insufficiently tested within assurance cycle.
indicative_signals: Audit scope exclusions unexplained; zero test evidence; missing artefacts.
rationale: Missing assurance tests conceal latent control failures from governance view.
notes: Integrated logging and audit coverage eliminate untested control zones.

description: Context stripped during transfer or transformation; lineage broken.
indicative_signals: Metadata tags stripped; inconsistent file labels; manual overrides observed.
rationale: Lost sensitivity tags reduce visibility of protected data across systems.
notes: Reinforces sensitivity labelling discipline across hybrid environments.

description: Identity assertion accepted without proper re-validation.
indicative_signals: API transfers without context headers; checksum or lineage loss events.
rationale: Missing metadata during transfer breaks lineage and integrity verification.
notes: Data-validation and federated-ID frameworks preserve contextual integrity.

description: Repetition of training causes message desensitisation.
indicative_signals: Unvalidated SAML assertions; federation trust errors; stale certificates.
rationale: Federation mis-trust exposes identities to replay or assertion spoofing.
notes: Revalidation and signed assertions strengthen federated trust chains.

description: Model performance diverges from validation baseline; accuracy loss.
indicative_signals: Decline in training participation; repeated phishing test failures.
rationale: Low training engagement increases vulnerability to social engineering.
notes: Rotational awareness and behavioural metrics sustain engagement.

description: Malicious or biased data injected to influence AI behaviour.
indicative_signals: Model accuracy drop; data-drift alerts; deviation from baseline metrics.
rationale: Model drift erodes detection accuracy and decision reliability.
notes: Continuous model validation aligns AI behaviour with operational baselines.

description: All workloads depend on single provider region; systemic fragility.
indicative_signals: Unexpected weight changes; adversarial sample patterns; data-integrity warnings.
rationale: Data poisoning corrupts AI behaviour, creating hidden systemic bias.
notes: Data-integrity and adversarial-testing controls detect manipulation attempts.

description: Inter-service dependency triggers multi-system outage chain.
indicative_signals: All assets in one CSP region; replication disabled; single-region outage impact.
rationale: Regional hosting concentration increases correlated outage risk.
notes: Multi-region redundancy offsets geographic dependency risk.

description: Devices lack patch or decommission plan; security decay over time.
indicative_signals: API timeouts cascading; dependency latency spikes; queue backlog growth.
rationale: Interdependent API timeouts propagate failures across multiple services.
notes: Dependency mapping and fault isolation prevent systemic outage chains.

description: Legacy cryptography vulnerable to future quantum attacks.
indicative_signals: Out-of-support firmware; device inventory mismatch; patch compliance < 80 %.
rationale: Unpatched or orphaned IoT devices expand the attack surface unchecked.
notes: Lifecycle governance ensures device retirement and patchability.

description: Incident playbooks untested or unrealistic; stale scenario data.
indicative_signals: Cryptographic deprecation warnings; use of non-PQC algorithms.
rationale: Legacy cryptography without PQC readiness risks future decryption exposure.
notes: Crypto-agility planning mitigates post-quantum exposure.

description: Metrics interpreted without validating data quality or scope.
indicative_signals: Exercise overdue; outdated contact lists; test participation < target.
rationale: Untested playbooks reduce incident readiness and learning continuity.
notes: Regular scenario exercises preserve procedural readiness.

description: SIEM rules or filters hide legitimate alerts; signals dropped.
indicative_signals: Dashboard anomalies ignored; data-integrity warnings dismissed.
rationale: Ignoring anomalous dashboards shows misplaced confidence in metrics.
notes: Metrics contextualised with validated data prevent analytic bias.

description: Monitoring data missing or corrupted; situational blindness.
indicative_signals: Missing telemetry feed; corrupted log stream; heartbeat gaps detected.
rationale: Missing telemetry feeds blind monitoring systems to live conditions.
notes: Telemetry aggregation, network monitoring, and integrity checks ensure continuity and authenticity of event data.

description: Service relationships undocumented; cascade or patch blind spot.
indicative_signals: Undefined dependency matrix; missing CMDB entries; patch sequencing issues.
rationale: Absent dependency mapping hides cumulative risk in change sequencing.
notes: Asset and supply-chain registries reveal transitive dependencies and strengthen systemic-risk modelling.

description: Vendor credentials remain active after contract termination.
indicative_signals: Active vendor accounts post-termination; stale API keys; orphaned access tokens.
rationale: Residual vendor credentials create unmonitored external access paths.
notes: Off-boarding workflows and federated-identity hygiene prevent dormant external credentials from persisting.

description: Human validation missing in AI-driven decision loops.
indicative_signals: No human review of AI output; override thresholds exceeded; audit trail gaps.
rationale: Lack of human review of AI output risks automation bias and error reinforcement.
notes: Model-governance controls and risk-assessment frameworks sustain accountability for AI-driven operations.

description: Failover or continuity exercises skipped or simulated poorly.
indicative_signals: DR drill skipped; failover logs absent; RTO/RPO targets unverified.
rationale: Skipped recovery drills mask resilience weaknesses until actual failure.
notes: Scenario simulation, continuity testing, and systemic-stress exercises verify preparedness under dynamic conditions.

description: Emergency or manual fixes circumvent change-approval flow.
indicative_signals: Change tickets missing; emergency changes unrecorded; version rollback errors.
rationale: Unrecorded emergency changes compromise traceability and rollback safety.
notes: Development lifecycle controls and governance checkpoints enforce traceable configuration changes.

description: Regulatory reporting timelines or obligations mis-aligned across regions.
indicative_signals: Conflicting breach notices; inconsistent reporting timelines; legal escalation flags.
rationale: Inconsistent breach reporting causes regulatory and reputational escalation.
notes: Privacy-governance and compliance-reporting controls manage conflicting regulatory obligations across regions.

description: Two or more controls mutually depend on each other’s outputs, creating circular fragility.
indicative_signals: Recurring circular alerts; dependent control metrics feeding each other.
rationale: Circular alert dependencies inflate confidence scores and mask genuine failure.
notes: Dependency and recovery mapping prevent recursive control failures during cascading events.
